DataElement.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire 7 Treatment or Medication Receiving for Pain Descriptive Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation that describes treatment or medication name currently being received for pain.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire Treatment or Medication Receiving for Pain
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire._A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale._A question about which treatments or medications an individual is receiving or has received for pain.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale.:A question about which treatments or medications an individual is receiving or has received for pain.

Concepts.longName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire
Concepts.definition: A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale.

Concepts.longName: Treatment or Medication Received for Pain
Concepts.definition: A question about which treatments or medications an individual is receiving or has received for pain.
